meanings.sent1: She fared well in her exams and was happy with her grades.
meanings.sent2: The team fared better this season than last year.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small size, the ant fared well in the race against the other insects.
meanings.sent4: The young plant fared through the harsh winter, showing resilience.
meanings.sent5: Her business fared smoothly after implementing the new strategy.

meanings.definition: To experience good or bad fortune
meanings.sent1: He fared poorly in the lottery, not winning any prizes.
meanings.sent2: The sailor fared well during the calm weather on the sea.
meanings.sent3: The cat fared surprisingly well in finding treats hidden around the house.
meanings.sent4: The old house fared through the storm, with only a few shingles blown off.
meanings.sent5: The student fared luckily in finding a lost wallet on the street.

meanings.sent1: They fared across the country on a road trip.
meanings.sent2: The train fared smoothly along the tracks towards its destination.
meanings.sent3: The bird fared swiftly through the sky, searching for its nest.
meanings.sent4: The hiker fared through the forest, enjoying the peaceful surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The car fared slowly up the steep hill, struggling with the incline.
